original_title: Kahawatte Murder: K9 Unit Summoned For Probe
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); An investigation revealed that the woman who was found dead close to her house in Welewatte, Kahawatte died after her throat was slit.
A post-mortem revealed that she suffered blunt force trauma to the head.
This crime has taken place in the area close to Kotakethana, where multiple women were murdered over a period of time.
71-year-old Wanitha Jayasundara was found dead close to her residence in Welewatte, Kahawatte.
She was a mother of three, and was living with one of her daughters.
On the day of the murder, her daughter had gone to work as usual and returned home at around 3:30 in the afternoon.
In her statement to the police, she said that she witnessed her mother's lifeless body when she returned home.
The body was found several feet away from the kitchen, which is located at the rear of the house.
Sri Lanka Police suspect that the woman was killed in the living room, and her body was moved out via the front door, and later placed at the back of the house.
Sri Lanka Police added that the investigation revealed that the blood stains in the living room had been washed off.
Police K-9 Unit Masha was brought to the location, and it was reported that the K-9 Unit had not left the garden area of the crime scene.
The murder was reported in Welewatte, and within a 6 km radius of this crime scene is the Kotakethana area, where multiple women have been brutally murdered in recent years.
Since 2008, a total of 18 murders, including three double homicides, have been reported from the Kotakethana, Dambulwala, Warapitiya, and Opatawatte areas.
